title: Gather Requirements
description: Conduct interviews and workshops with military personnel, cyber warfare experts, and stakeholders to gather comprehensive requirements for the simulation platform.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flows, and integration points. This design should consider scalability, performance, security requirements, modular design for easy maintenance and updates, separation of concerns (e.g., frontend, backend, data layer), microservices architecture for scalability and fault isolation, secure communication protocols and data encryption, robust authentication and authorization mechanisms, logging and monitoring systems, disaster recovery and backup strategies, integration with existing military systems and databases, adherence to best practices for each component, aiming for high availability and resilience. Additionally, focus on the following aspects: 1) Ensure that the design is compliant with relevant military standards, 2) Implement a clear documentation strategy for all components, including API specifications, 3) Provide a plan for testing and validating the system architecture before implementation, 4) Consider potential future scalability needs (e.g., supporting multiple simulated environments, handling large-scale data). If approved, please update the rfc_state field to 'READY_FOR_IMPLEMENTATION'.

title: Develop Simulation Engine
description: Implement the core simulation engine responsible for modeling cyber warfare scenarios, network topologies, and attack/defense strategies.

title: Implement User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for configuring simulation scenarios, visualizing network topologies, and monitoring simulation progress.

title: Develop Reporting and Analytics
description: Implement reporting and analytics capabilities to track simulation results, generate performance metrics, and provide insights for training and strategy evaluation.

title: Implement Comprehensive Security Measures
description: Thoroughly reinforce the simulation platform with stringent security standards including: data encryption (AES-256), role-based access controls, secure communication protocols (TLS/SSL), implementation of best practices for cybersecurity hygiene (such as regular updates, patch management, and least privilege principle), and incorporating security features in the design system architecture.

title: Set up Development and Testing Environment
description: Configure the development and testing environment, including version control, continuous integration, and deployment pipelines.

title: Develop Test Suite
description: Create a comprehensive test suite, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure the simulation platform's functionality and reliability.

title: Write Documentation
description: Develop user manuals, technical documentation, and training materials to support the deployment and usage of the simulation platform.

title: Conduct User Acceptance Testing
description: Perform user acceptance testing with military personnel and stakeholders to validate the simulation platform's functionality and usability.
